apihelp-doesuserexist-summary: Check if one or more users exist
apihelp-doesuserexist-example-mwdefault-: Check if the user <kbd>MediaWiki default</kbd> exists. This account is used by the MediaWiki installer and should always exist.
Check if the user <kbd>mediaWiki default</kbd> exists. This account is used by the MediaWiki installer and should always exist, but the name will be normalized to <kbd>MediaWiki default</kbd>.
apihelp-doesuserexist-example-invalid-sl: Check if the user <kbd>Foo/bar</kbd> exists. This account name is invalid and should never exist.
apihelp-doesuserexist-example-multi: Check if the users <kbd>MediaWiki default</kbd>, <kbd>mediaWiki default</kbd>, and <kbd>Foo/bar</kbd> exist, in a single request.
apiwarn-doesuserexist-duplicate-request: Duplicate request to check the name: $1
apihelp-getsyntaxhelp-summary: Get the help page for a content model
apihelp-getsyntaxhelp-param-contentmodel: The content model to get a help page for
apihelp-getsyntaxhelp-example-wikitext: Get the help page for <kbd>wikitext</kbd>, which is commonly configured.
apihelp-getsyntaxhelp-example-unknown: Get the help page for <kbd>unknown</kbd>, which is unlikely to be configured.
apihelp-getsyntaxhelp-example-invalid: Try to get the help page for <kbd>invalid</kbd>, which should fail since that is unlikely to be a valid content model.
